intro: Hieracium anchodontum, commonly known as the sandhill hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the northern United States and southern Canada. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as sandy soils and roadsides. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are arranged in a single stem and are surrounded by bracts. Hieracium anchodontum is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
